Platform.Title: HatfullPitt Mycobacterium smegmatis 30K v2
Platform.Manufacturer: PFGRC, The Institute for Genomic Research
Platform.Manufacture-Protocol: Slide Information Array Name : Mycobacterium smegmatis microarray version 2 Elements on Array : 29184 Elements on Array (minus empties): 28904 Grids: 48 Array Type : ss_oligo (70-mer) Surface Coating: Epoxy Printing Buffer(s): Nexterion with .01 CTAB, Schott buffer LEB E2 Arraying Machine(s): Genetix Oligo Replicates : 4x Oligos Designed : 6746 ORFs w/o oligo*: 1 Controls: 480 A. thaliana (70-mers) Strain Information Design Strain : ORFs in Design: Oligos Designed **: MC2 155 6898 6746 TIGR Spotfinder Printing Pattern MetaRow 12 MetaColumn 4 Pix X (pix) 450 Pin Y (pix) 450 Row Number 25 Column Number 25 X Spacing (pix) 17 Y Spacing (pix) 17 The user should remove slides from their packaging as soon as possible and store them at room temperature in a desiccator or a Rubbermaid® or Tupperware® container containing a bottom layer of anhydrous calcium sulfate such as Drierite®. Handle slides with extreme care as any scratching or rubbing of the slide surface may damage the printed DNA. Additionally, slides must be kept away from dust. Printed material is on the same side of the glass as the barcode. Slides should never be placed DNA side down.

Sample.Title: Plogcy5plogcy3slide113norm

Channel.Source: Log phase Planktonic culture of M. smegmatis
Channel.Treatment-Protocol: Harvested at optical density of 0.2 and processed for RNA extraction
Channel.Growth-Protocol: Grown in modified M63 media at 30C on a plantform shaker
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Using the Ambion's Ribopure RNA extraction kit
Channel.Label: Cy5
Channel.Label-Protocol: Using the instruction provided by PFGRC, TIGR at http://pfgrc.tigr.org/protocols/protocols.shtml

Channel.Source: Log Phase Planktonic culture of M.smegmatis
Channel.Treatment-Protocol: Harvested at optical density of 0.2 and processed for RNA extraction
Channel.Growth-Protocol: Grown in modified M63 media at 30C on a plantform shaker
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Using the Ambion's Ribopure RNA extraction kit
Channel.Label: Cy3
Channel.Label-Protocol: Using the instruction provided by PFGRC, TIGR at http://pfgrc.tigr.org/protocols/protocols.shtml

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: Using the instruction provided by PFGRC, TIGR at http://pfgrc.tigr.org/protocols/protocols.shtml
Sample.Scan-Protocol: Using the Axon4200 Dual Channel Scanner
Sample.Description: Gene Expression Data from Planktonic log phase culture compared against itself
Sample.Data-Processing: The data were processed and using GenePix Pro 4.1. The method of global intensity normalization was used.

Column.Name: VALUE
Column.Description: Log2 Ratio (635/532) of globally normalized intensity

Series.Title: Expression data from planktonic and biofilm cultures of Mycobacterium smegmatis
Series.Summary: Transition of microbial growth from planktonic to biofilm is associated with programmed changes in the global patterns of gene expression. These changes are likely to faciliate the appropriate physiological and metabolic adjustments that bacteria need to make during the development of biofilms. Using microarrays we have examined the changes in pattern of gene expression associated with growth of Mycobacterium smegmatis in various stages of planktonic and biofilm cultures. Keywords: developmental time course
Series.Overall-Design: M.smegmatis cells were harvested from logarithmic and stationary phase planktonic as well as 3day and 4day biofilm cultures. RNA extracted from these cells were subjected to labelling and hybridization on TIGR microarray chips according to the protocol described by the manufacturer.
